intro: Jatropha angustidens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf jatropha, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow with red or orange markings, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Jatropha angustidens is also known for its toxic seeds, which contain compounds that can be harmful if ingested.
